344&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;background-color:#99ff99; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;As of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;&gt;December&amp;#160;31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;&gt;$115
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; was available for borrowing under the Revolver. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;The interest rates for outstanding obligations at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;&gt;December&amp;#160;31

 2013
 the Company entered into a new credit agreement by and among GFA Brands
 Inc.
 UHF Acquisition Corp. and Udi's Healthy Foods
 LLC
 as borrowers
 or the &amp;#8220;Borrowers
&amp;#8221; the Company
 as a guarantor
 the other guarantors from time to time party thereto
 the lenders from time to time party thereto
 or the &amp;#8220;Lenders
&amp;#8221; and Citibank
 N.A.
 as administrative agent
 or the &amp;#8220;Agent&amp;#8221; (as subsequently amended
 the &amp;#8220;Credit Facility&amp;#8221;)
 pursuant to which the Borrowers established a senior secured credit facility
 or the &amp;#8220;Credit Facility
&amp;#8221; in an aggregate principal amount of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$330
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 consisting of a term loan B
 or  the &amp;#8220;Term Loan
&amp;#8221; in an aggregate principal amount of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$250
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a revolving credit facility
 or the &amp;#8220;Revolving Facility
&amp;#8221;  in an aggregate principal amount of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$80
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; (with sublimits for swingline loans and the issuance of letters of credit). The Term Loan will mature on July 9
 2020 and the Revolving Facility will mature on July 9
 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;On December 20
 2013
 the Company increased its senior secured term loan credit facility
 at the same interest rate as the original loan
 by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$25
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$275
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.  In addition
 the Company amended the financial covenants on its revolving credit facility to increase the senior secured funded debt-to-EBITDA (as defined in the Credit Facility) covenant by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;0.25&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;x for each quarterly period.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;On July 29
 2014
 we entered into the Amendment Agreement (the &amp;#8220;Third Amendment&amp;#8221;) by and among GFA Brands
 Inc.
 as borrower
 the Company
 as a guarantor
 the other guarantors party thereto
 the financial institutions party thereto
 as lenders
 and Citibank
 N.A.
 as administrative agent.&amp;#160; The Third Amendment amends the Credit Facility to
 among other things
 (a) increase the aggregate principal amount of the term loan facility by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$27.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 (b) increase the aggregate principal amount of the Revolving Facility from &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$80 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$115 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 (c) subject to compliance with certain leverage-based criteria
 decrease the interest rate margin with respect to the term loan facility by up to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;0.5%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 (d) increase the maximum total funded debt to consolidated EBITDA ratio to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;6.50&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;x for any fiscal quarter ending prior to December 31
 2015
 and to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;6.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;x for the fiscal quarter ending December 31
 2015 and each fiscal quarter thereafter and (e) revise the &amp;#8220;incremental&amp;#8221; term loan provision so that
 upon the satisfaction of certain conditions
 the borrower may increase the term and/or revolving commitments by an amount not to exceed the sum of (i) &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$100 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; and (ii) an additional amount so long as various specified leverage ratios are not exceeded
 subject to receipt of additional lending commitments for such loans.&amp;#160; Proceeds of the new term loans borrowed in connection with the Third Amendment were used to repay outstanding revolving loans under the Credit Facility
 to pay fees and expenses in connection with the Third Amendment and for cash on the balance sheet.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Interest&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;Outstanding amounts under the Term Loan bear interest at a rate per annum equal to
 at the Borrowers' option
 either (a) LIBOR plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;3.50%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; or (b) a Base Rate (equal in this context to the greater of (i) the Agent's prime rate
 (ii) the federal funds rate plus 1/2 of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;1.00%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; and (iii) LIBOR plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;1.00%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;) (but subject to a minimum of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;2.00%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;) plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2.50%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.   The Term Loan amortizes in equal quarterly installments of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;0.25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; of the initial principal amount beginning on September 30
 2013
 with the balance due at maturity.  The margin over LIBOR and the Base Rate for the Term Loan may be adjusted periodically based on the Company's ratio of first lien funded debt to consolidated EBITDA
 with &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;3.5%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; per annum being the maximum LIBOR margin and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;2.5%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; per annum being the maximum Base Rate margin established by such adjustment mechanism. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;Outstanding amounts under the Revolving Facility initially bear interest at a rate per annum equal to
 at the Borrowers' option
 either (a) LIBOR plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;3.50%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; or (b) a Base Rate (equal in this context to the greatest of (i) the Agent's prime rate
 (ii) the federal funds rate plus 1/2 of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;1.00%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; and (iii) LIBOR plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;1.00%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;) plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2.50%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;. The margin over LIBOR and the Base Rate for the Revolving Facility may be adjusted periodically based on the Company's ratio of total funded debt to consolidated EBITDA
 with &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;3.50%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; per annum being the maximum LIBOR margin and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2.50%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; per annum being the maximum Base Rate margin established by such adjustment mechanism. The Borrowers are required to pay a commitment fee on the unused commitments under the New Revolving Credit Facility at a rate equal to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;0.50%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; per annum.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Guarantees&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;The loans and other obligations under the Credit Facility (including in respect of hedging agreements and cash management obligations) are (a) guaranteed by the Company and its existing and future wholly-owned domestic subsidiaries and (b) secured by substantially all of the assets of the Company and its existing and future wholly-owned domestic subsidiaries
 in each case subject to certain customary exceptions and limitations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Covenants&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;So long as any borrowings under the Revolving Facility are outstanding (other than letters of credit that have been cash collateralized in accordance with the terms of the Credit Facility) as of the last day of any fiscal quarter of the Company
 the terms of the Credit Facility require the Company and its subsidiaries (on a consolidated basis and subject to certain customary exceptions) to maintain a maximum total funded debt to consolidated EBITDA ratio of not more than &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;6.50&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; to 1.0
 for any fiscal quarter prior to December 31
 2015
 and decreasing to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;6.00&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; to 1.0 for the fiscal quarter December 31
 2015 and each fiscal quarter thereafter.  As of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;December&amp;#160;31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 we were in compliance with our financial covenants.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;In addition
 the Credit Facility contains (a) customary provisions related to mandatory prepayment of the loans thereunder with (i) &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;50%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; of Excess Cash Flow (as defined in the Credit Facility)
 subject to step-downs to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;0%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; of Excess Cash Flow at certain leverage-based thresholds and (ii) the proceeds of asset sales and casualty events (subject to certain customary limitations
 exceptions and reinvestment rights) and (b) certain covenants that
 among other things
 restrict additional indebtedness
 liens and encumbrances
 investments
 acquisitions
 loans and advances
 mergers
 consolidations and asset dispositions
 dividends and other restricted payments
 transactions with affiliates and other matters customarily restricted in such agreements
 in each case
 subject to certain customary exceptions.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;The Credit Facility also contains customary events of default
 including payment defaults
 breaches of representations and warranties
 covenant defaults
 cross-defaults to certain material contracts and to other material indebtedness in excess of specified amounts
 certain events of bankruptcy and insolvency
 certain ERISA events
 judgments in excess of specified amounts
 certain impairments to the guarantees or collateral documents
 and change in control defaults.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Other&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;Certain of the lenders under the Credit Facility (or their affiliates) have provided
 and may in the future provide
 certain commercial banking
 financial advisory
 and investment banking services in the ordinary course of business for the Company and its subsidiaries
 for which they receive customary fees and commissions.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Contract Payable and Capital Leases&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;In addition to the indebtedness under the Credit Facility
 we have recorded a contract payable of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$1
375&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; representing the unpaid balance on a 2010 acquisition.  This amount will be paid in the first quarter of 2015
 together with related interest.  As of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;December&amp;#160;31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 this amount is due within 12 months and therefore included within Accounts payable and accrued expenses on the Consolidated Balance Sheets.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;We have &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;five&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; capital leases resulting in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$8
677&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; of capital lease obligations for certain of our manufacturing equipment as of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;December&amp;#160;31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.  These leases have terms that expire from June 30
 2015 through December 1
 2021 and have interest rates of approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;5.5%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Maturities&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;Under the Credit Facility
 the contract payable and capital lease obligations
 the Company and the Borrowers are required to pay the following amounts for their collective debt and contract obligations during the years ended December 31:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=4 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width=89% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=9% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#99ff99;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;background-color:#99ff99; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#99ff99;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;5

 2012
 we acquired Udi's from its majority unit holder
 Hubson Acquisition
 LLC
 an affiliate of E&amp;amp;A Industries based in Indianapolis
 IN
 the family of founder Ehud Baron
 and other minority unit holders.  Total cash consideration was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$126
910&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.  The acquisition
 as well as the refinancing of existing outstanding debt
 was financed with the proceeds of a new &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$280
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; senior secured credit facility.  Based in Denver
 Colorado
 Udi's markets gluten free products under the &amp;#8220;Udi's Gluten Free Foods&amp;#8221; brand in the retail market
 and since mid-2011
 food service channels.  Udi's is a leading brand in gluten free bread and baked goods.  In addition
 Udi's markets other gluten free products including frozen pizza and granola.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;On December 23
 2013
 we acquired all of the issued and outstanding units of Phil&amp;#8217;s Fresh Foods
 LLC
 owner of EVOL Foods (EVOL).  Total cash consideration was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$48
941&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.  We funded the purchase using a combination of cash on hand and borrowing under the Credit Facility (as defined below).   Based in Boulder
 Colorado
 EVOL manufactures and markets frozen foods with a focus on pure and simple ingredients.&amp;#160; EVOL&amp;#8217;s products include those that are antibiotic-free
 hormone-free
 GMO-free
 and have no artificial preservatives or flavors.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;We accounted for both acquisitions pursuant to ASC No. 805
 &amp;#8220;Business Combinations.&amp;#8221;  Accordingly
 we recorded net assets acquired and liabilities assumed at their fair values.  &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;The following summarizes the fair values of the assets acquired and liabilities assumed related to the EVOL acquisition as of the acquisition date:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:99.41520467836257%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=4 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width=85% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=13% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#99ff99;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; 418&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #000000; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;The pro forma amounts have been calculated after applying our accounting policies.&amp;#160; Included in the pro forma results is the interest expense and amortization of deferred financing costs associated with the new debt structure in place at the time of the EVOL acquisition
 as if it were in place as of January 1
 2012
 and the amortization expense of the fair value of the finite-lived intangible assets
 as though the acquisitions had been consummated as of January 1
 2012.&amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;The pro forma information does not necessarily reflect the actual results of operations had the acquisition been consummated at the beginning of the period indicated nor is it necessarily indicative of future operating results.  The pro forma information does not give effect to any potential net sales enhancements or operating efficiencies that could result from the acquisition.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;On May 1
 2013
 we acquired Davies
 a United Kingdom based gluten free bakery and bread manufacturer for approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3
900&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.&amp;#160; On July 10
 2013
 we acquired &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;80%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; of GlucoBrands
 LLC
 owner of Level
 for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$2
400&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.  In February 2014
 we acquired an additional &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;8%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; of Level for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$238&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 and in July 2014
 we acquired approximately an additional &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;1%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; of Level for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$42&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.    Level provides products to customers to help in the daily management of diabetes.  On October&amp;#160;15
 2014
 we acquired Real Food Matters
 LLC
 for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;&gt;$800&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 a consulting company specializing in conceptualization
 product development
 commercialization and optimization for retail food brands
 food manufacturers
 and restaurant concepts.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;These transactions have been accounted for using the acquisition method of accounting in accordance with GAAP and the operating results of all acquired companies
 from the date of acquisition


 2005 under the name Boulder Specialty Brands
 Inc. in order to serve as a vehicle for the acquisition of a then-unidentified operating business and/or brand in the consumer food and beverage industry.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;On May 21
 2007
 we completed a merger with GFA Brands
 Inc.
 or &amp;#8220;GFA
&amp;#8221; which owned and marketed the Smart Balance&amp;#174; line of products
 among others. GFA became our wholly-owned subsidiary and is currently one of our operating entities. After the merger
 the Boulder Specialty Brands
 Inc. corporate name was changed to Smart Balance
 Inc.  Pursuant to the merger agreement with GFA
 we paid an aggregate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$491
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; in cash as merger consideration. The cash consideration for the merger was funded with cash from our December 2005 initial public offering
 the proceeds of a private placement and secured debt financings.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;On August 3
 2011
 we acquired Glutino Food Group
 or &amp;#8220;Glutino.&amp;#8221;  Glutino became our wholly-owned subsidiary and is currently one of our operating entities.  Pursuant to the share purchase agreement for the Glutino acquisition
 we paid an aggregate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$66
319&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; in cash consideration.  The cash consideration for the merger was funded with borrowings under our revolving credit facility.  &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;On July 2
 2012
 we acquired Udi's Healthy Foods
 LLC
 or &amp;#8220;Udi's.&amp;#8221;  Total cash consideration was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$126
910&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.  The acquisition
 as well as the refinancing of existing outstanding debt
 was financed with the proceeds of a new &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$280
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; senior secured credit facility.  &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;On December 31
 2012
 the Smart Balance
 Inc. corporate name was changed to Boulder Brands
 Inc. (&amp;#8220;Boulder Brands&amp;#8221; or the &amp;#8220;Company&amp;#8221;).  We, us and our mean Boulder Brands
 Inc. and its consolidated subsidiaries.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;On March 5
 2013
 the Company formed a new partnership called Boulder Brands Investment Group
 LLC (BIG) with a third party.  BIG invests in early-stage growth companies in the natural and organic food and beverage sectors.&amp;#160; In the second quarter of 2013
 the partners of BIG made their initial capital contributions and BIG made its first investment totaling &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$2
071&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.  In the third quarter of 2013
 BIG made additional investments totaling &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$6
680&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.  In the fourth quarter of 2014
 BIG made two additional investments totaling &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;&gt;$3
000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.  All investments have been accounted for under the cost method and fair value has not been estimated as there have been no identified events or changes in circumstances that would have an adverse effect on the value of these investments.&amp;#160; As the Company has a controlling financial interest in BIG
 it is consolidated with these Consolidated Financial Statements
 and the applicable noncontrolling interest is reflected herein.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;On May 1
 2013
 we acquired Davies
 a United Kingdom based gluten free bakery and bread manufacturer for approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3
900&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.&amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;On July 10
 2013
 we acquired &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;80%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; of GlucoBrands
 LLC
 owner of Level Life
 for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$2
400&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.  In connection with this acquisition
 we simultaneously entered into a call agreement with the sellers
 whereby we have the right
 but not the obligation
 to purchase the remaining equity interests in GlucoBrands
 LLC
 starting on January 1
 2016
 at an amount based on certain predefined profit metrics.  In February 2014
 we acquired an additional &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;8%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; of Level for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$238&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 and in July 2014
 we acquired approximately an additional &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;1%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; of Level for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$42&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.   Level provides convenient food products to customers which help them create a diabetes-friendly diet as part of their daily management of diabetes.  &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;On December 23
 2013
 we acquired &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;100%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; of the equity interests of Phil&amp;#8217;s Fresh Foods
 LLC
 owner of EVOL Foods for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$48
941&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;.   Based in Boulder
 Colorado
 EVOL manufactures and markets frozen foods with a focus on pure and simple ingredients.&amp;#160; EVOL&amp;#8217;s products include those that are antibiotic-free
 hormone-free
 GMO-free
 and have no artificial preservatives or flavors.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;On October&amp;#160;15
 2014
 we acquired Real Food Matters
 LLC
 for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$800&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;


 the Financial Accounting Standards Board issued Accounting Standards Update (ASU) No.&amp;#160;2014-09
 Revenue from Contracts with Customers. This ASU supersedes the revenue recognition requirements in Accounting Standards Codification 605
 Revenue Recognition, and most industry-specific guidance throughout the Codification. The standard requires entities to recognize the amount of revenue that reflects the consideration to which the company expects to be entitled in exchange for the transfer of promised goods or services to customers. This ASU is effective for fiscal years beginning after December&amp;#160;15
 2016
 and for interim periods within those fiscal years. The Company is in the process of assessing both the method and the impact of the adoption of ASU 2014-09 on its financial position
 results of operations
 cash flows and financial statement disclosures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;In August 2014
 the FASB issued ASU No. 2014-15
 Presentation of Financial Statements - Going Concern: Disclosures about an Entity&amp;#8217;s Ability to Continue as a Going Concern. The new standard requires management to perform interim and annual assessments of an entity&amp;#8217;s ability to continue as a going concern within one year of the date the financial statements are issued. An entity must provide certain disclosures if conditions or events raise substantial doubt about the entity&amp;#8217;s ability to continue as a going concern. The new guidance is effective for annual periods ending after December 15
 2016
 and interim periods thereafter. The Company is currently assessing the impact of the adoption of ASU No. 2014-15 on its financial position

 we complete this evaluation by comparing the carrying amount of the assets against the estimated undiscounted future cash flows associated with them. If such evaluations indicate that the future undiscounted cash flows of amortizable long-lived assets are not sufficient to recover the carrying value of such assets

338&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;border-top:1px solid #000000; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;369


374&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1
270&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$974&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;


 in connection with the acquisition of Udi's and establishment of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;two&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; reportable operating segments
 we eliminated several senior management positions
 streamlining our management team.  During 2012
 charges of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$2
328&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; were incurred for severance costs
 and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$96&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; for other associated expenses.  In 2013
 we began a process to increase efficiency at our Udi&amp;#8217;s manufacturing facilities
 which involved the consolidation of several facilities into &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;one&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; new
 state-of the art facility.&amp;#160; During 2013
 charges of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$2
395&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; were incurred for asset write-offs and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$359&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; were incurred for related expenses associated with this restructuring effort.  During &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 additional charges of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1
064&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; were incurred in connection with the Udi's facility consolidation
 of which &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$480&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; were for lease exit costs
 net of estimated subleases
 and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$584&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; were incurred for asset write-offs.   During 2014
 we also incurred additional charges of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$2
068&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; associated with the restructuring of certain executive management positions.  Additionally in 2014
 we determined it was necessary to relocate certain functional departments within the company to one central location.  As a result of this
 we expect to incur approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;&gt;$1
992&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; of one-time termination benefits
 as well as approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;&gt;$400&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; for other associated exit costs.  As of December 31
 2014

Consists of asset write-offs.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:4px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;The accrued restructuring costs as of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;December&amp;#160;31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$691&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$9&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 respectively
 are reflected in Accounts payable and accrued expenses in the Consolidated Balance Sheets. The liabilities for other closure and exit costs primarily relate to contractually required lease obligations and other contractually committed costs associated with facilities that are no longer used.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;We expect to pay the facility obligations associated with the Udi's facility consolidation through October 2020


 which occurs upon the receipt and acceptance of product by the customer. The earnings process is complete once the customer order has been placed and approved and the product shipped has been received by the customer. Product is sold to customers on credit terms established on an individual basis. The credit factors used include historical performance
 current economic conditions and the nature and volume of the product.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;We offer our customers and consumers a variety of sales and incentive programs
 including discounts
 allowances
 coupons
 slotting fees
 and advertising; such amounts are estimated and recorded as a reduction in revenue.  We sell products to customers without a&amp;#160;right of return


 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;(555&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-right:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;  and valuation allowance
 resulting from temporary differences between accounting for financial and tax reporting purposes
 were as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=8 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width=59% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=18% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=18% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#99ff99;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=3 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;background-color:#99ff99;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:center;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;font-weight:bold;&gt;December&amp;#160;31

 &lt;br clear=none/&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#99ff99;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=3 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;background-color:#99ff99;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:center;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;font-weight:bold;&gt;December&amp;#160;31


 the Company's previous Natural and Smart Balance segments have evolved into its current Natural and Balance segments
 which aligns with the way the Company began to operate its business in the first quarter of 2014.  The Natural segment consists of our Udi's
 Glutino
 Davies and EVOL branded products.  The Balance segment consists of Smart Balance
 Earth Balance and Level life branded products.  Prior period amounts have been reclassified to conform with current period's presentation. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; &amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;Net sales and brand profit are the primary measures used by our Chief Operating Decision Maker (&amp;#8220;CODM&amp;#8221;) to evaluate segment operating performance and to decide how to allocate resources to segments.  Our CODM is the Company's Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer.   Brand profit is calculated as gross profit less marketing
 selling and royalty expense (income)
 net.  Assets are reviewed by the CODM on a consolidated basis and are not reported by operating segment.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;The contribution of our reportable segments to net sales and brand profit and the reconciliation to consolidated amounts are summarized below.  &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:99.80506822612085%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=12 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width=59% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=11% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=11% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=11% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#99ff99;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; 592&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;background-color:#99ff99;border-top:1px solid #000000; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#99ff99;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;background-color:#99ff99;border-top:1px solid #000000; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;background-color:#99ff99;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;775
483&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;background-color:#99ff99;border-top:1px solid #000000; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#99ff99;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;background-color:#99ff99;border-top:1px solid #000000; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;background-color:#99ff99;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;681


 &amp;#8220;Compensation - Stock Compensation


 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; were approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$31
738&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$24
705&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;$22
317&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; respectively


 Inc. and all of its wholly owned and majority owned subsidiaries.  The third-party investors' share of the net loss of these majority owned subsidiaries is reflected in net loss attributable to noncontrolling interest in the Consolidated Statements of Operations and Comprehensive Income (Loss).  All intercompany balances and transactions have been eliminated.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Use of estimates and assumptions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;The preparation of financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America
 or &amp;#8220;GAAP
&amp;#8221; requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the amounts reported in the financial statements and footnotes.  Actual results could differ materially from those estimates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Restructuring
 acquisition and integration-related costs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;Restructuring
 acquisition and integration-related costs represent restructuring charges and external costs related to acquired businesses and integrating those acquired businesses.&amp;#160; Acquisition and integration-related costs primarily include expenditures for legal
 accounting
 consulting and integration of systems and processes.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Cash and cash equivalents&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;We consider all highly liquid investments with original maturities of three months or less when purchased to be cash equivalents. At &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;December&amp;#160;31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 we did not have any cash equivalents.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:4px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Accounts receivable&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;Accounts receivable are carried at original invoice amount less allowances for cash discounts and doubtful receivables based on a review of all outstanding amounts. Management determines the allowance for doubtful accounts by regularly evaluating individual customer receivables and considering a customer&amp;#8217;s financial condition
 credit history and current economic conditions. Accounts receivable are written off when deemed uncollectible. Bad debt expense was not material to us for the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;December&amp;#160;31
 2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;. Recoveries of receivables previously written off are recorded when received. We do not charge interest on past due receivables.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:4px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:99.4140625%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=16 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td width=6% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=30% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=11% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=11% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=11% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=11% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=11% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td width=1% rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#99ff99;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;
